data.text: Look at the map again. look at US , Africa as a whole and South Africa and Europe. I never said “ causation” I guess u aren’t familiar with the lancet study  on hydroxychloroquine  that was https://t.co/2Vap6hnVOr know one of the most respected references world wide.
@granger_md @CDCgov @FDA @NIH @WHO So, what is the connection with the conversation?
@QuentinChaine @CDCgov @FDA @NIH @WHO Like when the Lancet retracted its hydroxychloroquine study? Is the Lancet a weak reference?

@granger_md @CDCgov @FDA @NIH @WHO When they change study's conclusion I don't think we can call it serious reference. 
A strong would mean that when a country is green on the left it's yellow on the left and when red on the left also red the right. There is to many counterexample.
@QuentinChaine @CDCgov @FDA @NIH @WHO “Serious reference” is a matter of perception. Do u have data to refute there is a correlation?
@granger_md @CDCgov @FDA @NIH @WHO Strong ? Were you see strong ? And also correlation is not causality. And c19study is not a serious reference ...
